customLabels.name: Addr_No_Batch
customLabels.label: The specified service does not support Batch Address Verification.

customLabels.name: Addr_Settings_Intro_Body1
customLabels.label: The Address Verification API lets you verify addresses as you add them to Salesforce. The API also lets you standardise addresses when you save them (for example, it converts any instance of Street to St in the saved record).

customLabels.name: Addr_Settings_Intro_Body2
customLabels.label:
To get started:

1. Open a third-party address verification account. (Some are free for nonprofits.)
2. In your address verification service, create the required authentication ID and/or token.
3. Return to this settings page, click the Edit button above, and paste the ID and/or token into the appropriate fields.
4. Complete the remaining fields and click Save. The help text for each field provides more information.

customLabels.name: Addr_Settings_Notice
customLabels.label: Address verification will only work for records you create from this point on. Verification does not apply to contact information that you've already entered in Salesforce.

customLabels.name: Addr_Settings_Test_Body
customLabels.label: To test your Secret Key Pair, enter any US Zip/Postal Code:

customLabels.name: Addr_Token_Error
customLabels.label: You must provide an Auth Token.

customLabels.name: Addr_Unauthorized_Endpoint
customLabels.label: The Remote Site URL for the SmartyStreetsZip endpoint is invalid. Verify the correct URL with Smarty Streets, and update the SmartyStreetsZip endpoint in Setup > Security > Remote Site Settings.

customLabels.name: Addr_Valid_Key_Pair
customLabels.label: Your Secret Key Pair is valid.

customLabels.name: Addr_Verification_Batch_Body
customLabels.label: Click Verify All Addresses to verify and standardise all addresses in your organisation. The mass verification process uses the settings from above.

customLabels.name: Addr_Verification_Batch_Not_Supported
customLabels.label: The selected service does not support Batch Address Validation.

customLabels.name: Addr_Verification_Batch_SmartyStreets_Message
customLabels.label: SmartyStreets will verify addresses in batches of 100.

customLabels.label: There was an error loading the validator class {0}

customLabels.name: Addr_Verification_Undefined_Class
customLabels.label: Address verification class not defined in the settings. Cannot perform address verification.

customLabels.name: Addr_Verification_Wrong_Class
customLabels.label: No class with the specified name exists. Cannot perform address verification.

customLabels.name: Addr_Verification_Wrong_Interface
customLabels.label: The address validation class does not implement the required interface. Cannot perform address verification.

customLabels.name: Addr_Verify_Google_Help
customLabels.label: The Google Geocoding API requires a value for Authentication Token only. This can be found by going to Visit the APIs console at https://code.google.com/apis/console and log in with your Google Account. Click the Services link from the left-hand menu in the APIs Console, then activate the Geocoding API service. Once the service has been activated, your API key is available from the API Access page, in the Simple API Access section. More information on this service and what it provides can be found here: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/.

customLabels.name: CONV_Accept_Risk
customLabels.label: I accept the risk associated with using this tool, including data loss and inconsistent data.

customLabels.name: CONV_Account_Field_For_Old_HH_ID
customLabels.label: Select a field to store the original Household object Id.

customLabels.name: CONV_Activities_Reparented
customLabels.label: Transfers Activities and Tasks associated with One-to-One or Individual Accounts to new Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: CONV_Address_Overrides_Set
customLabels.label: Selects Address Override for any Contact whose address is different from the Household Address.

customLabels.name: CONV_Addresses_Mapped
customLabels.label: Creates Address records based on existing Household and Contact addresses, and associates the new Address records with the new Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: CONV_All_Backed_Up
customLabels.label: I've backed up my data using the Export Data tool in Setup | Data Management.

customLabels.name: CONV_All_Dup_Rules_Disabled
customLabels.label: I have disabled all Data.com Duplication Management Rules.

customLabels.name: CONV_All_Households_Selected
customLabels.label: Runs the conversion process for all existing Household objects and related Contacts. (Does not run conversion for Contacts not currently associated with a Household.)

customLabels.name: CONV_All_Required_Removed
customLabels.label: I have removed required field restrictions for all custom fields.

customLabels.name: CONV_All_Triggers_Disabled
customLabels.label: Disables all NPSP triggers. NOTE: The tool does not disable your custom triggers. You should manually disable any custom triggers before proceeding.

customLabels.name: CONV_All_Users_Logged_Out
customLabels.label: All users have logged out of my Salesforce instance.

customLabels.name: CONV_All_WFR_Disabled
customLabels.label: I have disabled all workflows and custom validation rules.

customLabels.name: CONV_Batching_Explanation
customLabels.label: This tool will process your existing Contacts with Households in batches of 200 Households at a time, attempting to convert them to Household Accounts. Any errors during the conversion will result in one or more failed batches of Contacts while other batches may succeed. This could leave your data in an inconsistent state. If this occurs, you will need to immediately resolve the issue and re-run the conversion utility. This tool takes the following actions in converting your data:

customLabels.name: CONV_Contacts_Attached
customLabels.label: Disconnects Contacts from their One-to-One or Individual Account, and attaches them to their newly created Household Account.

customLabels.name: CONV_ConversionAccessDenied
customLabels.label: You don't have the required system permissions to convert. Contact your system administrator for assistance.

customLabels.name: CONV_Fundamental_Changes
customLabels.label: You are about to make fundamental changes to your Salesforce data and data model. Reports, dashboards, and more may have to be modified to account for these changes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are not responsible for any data or data integrity loss. Do you still wish to proceed?

customLabels.name: CONV_Local_Expert
customLabels.label: I've consulted with my local Salesforce expert.

customLabels.name: CONV_Master_Address_Set
customLabels.label: Sets the Household Account address. Uses the current Household address if it exists, or one of the Contact addresses based on frequency of use or highest Contact giving.

customLabels.name: CONV_New_Affiliations
customLabels.label: Restructures Contact and org Account associations by creating Affiliation records, and sets the Primary Affiliation field on Contact.

customLabels.name: CONV_New_Households_Created
customLabels.label: Creates a new Household Account for each Household object record.

customLabels.name: CONV_Non_NPSP_Apps
customLabels.label: I have disabled or temporarily uninstalled all non-NPSP apps.

customLabels.name: CONV_Old_Household_Objects
customLabels.label: Does NOT delete Household objects after conversion is complete. You should manually delete these after you've verified the conversion.

customLabels.name: CONV_Only_Household_Contacts
customLabels.label: I am aware this tool will only work for Contacts that currently have a Household associated.

customLabels.name: CONV_Opportunities_Reparented
customLabels.label: Removes Opportunities from One-to-One or Individual Accounts and associates them with the new Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: CONV_Original_HH_Id
customLabels.label: You can optionally select a custom field on Account to store the original Household object Id. Storing this Id can be useful if you later want to reparent any lookups or child objects originally on the Household object to the new Household Account. Account Field selections are limited to unused custom text or text area fields.

customLabels.name: CONV_Page_Description
customLabels.label: This page is designed to help you convert your organisation from an existing One-to-One or Individual Account Model to the Household Account Model.

customLabels.name: CONV_Permanent_Change
customLabels.label: Account Model Conversion is a permanent change. Please consider this action carefully before proceeding. While the conversion is in process, your database functionality will be temporarily disabled. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are not responsible for any data loss, modifications, or corruption that occur as a result of this operation. Please proceed at YOUR OWN RISK. You'll need to confirm that you've taken the following steps before beginning the conversion:

customLabels.name: CONV_Primary_Contacts_Set
customLabels.label: Sets Primary Contact values for all Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: CONV_Record_Ownership_Transferred
customLabels.label: I have transferred any records owned by inactive users to active users.

customLabels.name: CONV_Selected_Field_Bad
customLabels.label: The field you selected to store the Household Id is of the wrong datatype or invalid in some way. Please select a different Account field.

customLabels.name: CONV_Selected_Field_Verification_Failure
customLabels.label: The conversion tool encountered an error when attempting to verify the validity of your selected Account field. Without this verification, the conversion tool can't determine if your field mapping, and therefore your conversion, will be successful. You may proceed at your own risk, or select a different field to hold the Household Id.

customLabels.name: CONV_Tested_in_Sandbox
customLabels.label: I have tested the conversion process in a fresh sandbox.

customLabels.name: CONV_Triggers_Reenabled
customLabels.label: Re-enables all NPSP triggers. NOTE: You'll need to manually re-enable any custom triggers you disabled for the conversion. Also, the utility re-enables all NPSP triggers, so if you selectively disabled any of them beforehand, you'll need to manually disable them again.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterGroupActiveRollupsHelpText
customLabels.label: The list of rollups that are using this filter group. As long as there are rollups listed here, you can't delete this filter group.

customLabels.name: CMT_DeleteConfirm
customLabels.label: Are you sure you want to delete this {0}?

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterGroupDeleteError
customLabels.label: You can't delete this filter group because there is at least one rollup using it. To delete this filter group, either remove it from the associated rollups or delete the rollups.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterGroupDescriptionHelpText
customLabels.label: It's important to enter a detailed description that explains the filter rules in this group so that users in your org can understand if this filter group is right for their rollup.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterGroupNameHelpText
customLabels.label: A unique name for this filter group.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterGroupNameLimitError
customLabels.label: Filter group name is limited to 40 characters.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterRulesHelpText
customLabels.label: The list of rules included in this filter group. The filter rules set the criteria to ensure that you only get the data you need. Keep in mind that filter groups use AND criteria for filter rules, so if the data doesn't match ALL filter rules within a filter group, it won't be included in the rollup.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterRulesValueHelpText
customLabels.label: If the Operator is In List or Not in List and you don't see a picklist, enter values separated by semi-colons.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterRuleDeleteWarning
customLabels.label: There are rollups using the filter group that this rule is part of. If you delete this filter rule, it will affect those rollup calculations. Are you sure you want to delete?

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterRuleDuplicateError
customLabels.label: This filter rule already exists in this filter group. Edit one or more fields to create a unique filter rule.

customLabels.name: CMT_FilterRuleFieldsMissing
customLabels.label: One or more fields are missing. Complete all fields to save this filter rule.

customLabels.name: ConfirmDeleteAccount
customLabels.label: {0} is the only Contact in the {1} Account. Deleting this Contact would leave an empty Account. Would you like to delete {1}, including {0}, instead?

customLabels.name: ConfirmDeleteLeaveAccountEmpty
customLabels.label: {0} is the only Contact in the Account. Deleting this Contact would leave an empty Account.

customLabels.name: CRLP_AdvancedCustomizationText
customLabels.label: These fields determine what information is being summarised and provide the normal defaults for Donations. You can edit them as needed.

customLabels.name: CRLP_BatchCalculating
customLabels.label: The rollups batch job is calculating and may take a few moments to complete. Go back to the {0} and refresh to see updated rollup values.

customLabels.name: CRLP_BatchSkipped
customLabels.label: Today's scheduled {0} batch job was skipped because a previous {0} job was still running. The next batch job will run as scheduled. No action is required; this error is for information purposes only.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupIntroHelpText
customLabels.label: Select the Target Object to determine the available fields, then select the Target Field that this information should roll up to. Be sure to enter a detailed description that will help you (and others) understand exactly what this rollup does.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupTargetObjectHelpText
customLabels.label: The object determines which Target Fields are available for you to roll up donation data to. The available Target Objects are Account, Contact, General Accounting Unit, and Recurring Donation.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupTargetFieldHelpText
customLabels.label: Custom field on the selected Target Object that you are rolling up donation data to. Note that a Target Field can only be associated with one rollup.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupActiveHelpText
customLabels.label: Indicates that the rollup is active. Inactive rollups won't be calculated along with active rollups.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupDescriptionHelpText
customLabels.label: It's important to enter a detailed description so that you (or other users) understand exactly what this rollup calculates. The description will show when you hover over the rollup in the list view.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupTypeHelpText
customLabels.label: The combination of which object you're rolling up data from and whether the rollup is a hard credit or soft credit.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupFilterGroupHelpText
customLabels.label: The field shows which filter group to apply to this rollup. A filter group is a collection of filter rules that determine which records get rolled up.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupOperationHelpText
customLabels.label: Determines how the donation data will roll up. Is it a sum, an average, or a best year total (to name just a few)? Available values are determined by the type of the Target Field.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupFiscalYearHelpText
customLabels.label: Calculates rollups based on fiscal year settings (instead of calendar year).

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupTimeBoundOperationHelpText
customLabels.label: The time period for this rollup. You can roll up data for all time, a certain number of days, or a specific year.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupYearsAgoHelpText
customLabels.label: Choose the number of years ago that you want to roll up data for. Keep in mind that only the data for that calendar (or fiscal) year will roll up. So, if the current year is 2018 and you choose 2 years ago, the roll up will include data for 2016.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupDaysBackHelpText
customLabels.label: Choose the number of days back (from today) that you want to roll up data for.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupDetailFieldHelpText
customLabels.label: The field from the result of the rollup operation that you want to copy to the Target Field. Only available if the Operation is a single result operation (First, Last, Largest, or Smallest). This list only shows fields whose field types are compatible with the selected Target field.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupDateFieldHelpText
customLabels.label: The date field to use when calculating the rollup. This is the date that the Time Frame uses to figure out whether to include this record or not.

customLabels.name: CRLP_CreateRollupAmountFieldHelpText
customLabels.label: The amount field to use when calculating the rollup.

customLabels.name: CRLP_DaysBack
customLabels.label: You must enter a positive whole number that is less than 10000.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementDisabledHeader
customLabels.label: Almost there! Just need you to check on a couple of things first . . .

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementDisabledMessage
customLabels.label:
(1) If you're not already using Lightning Experience, click Switch to Lightning Experience at the top of your screen.
(2) Enable Customisable Rollups by going to NPSP Settings | Donations | Customisable Rollups.

Return here to the Upgrade to Enhanced Recurring Donations page.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementDryRunOutdatedError
customLabels.label: It's been longer than 7 days since you completed a migration validation. Refresh the page and click Validate Migration to confirm that your data will migrate without errors.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementDryRunOutdatedInfo
customLabels.label: It's been longer than 7 days since you completed a migration validation. Click Validate Migration to confirm that your data will migrate without errors.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementDryRunIntro
customLabels.label:
NPSP simulates migrating your existing data to the Enhanced Recurring Donations model and identifies errors. If there are errors, go to NPSP Settings | System Tools | Error Log. After you fix the errors, return here and validate the migration again. Once the validation completes without errors, you can proceed to the next step.

The validation process may take some time to complete. You can leave this page and return later to check the progress.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementEnableConfirm
customLabels.label: I confirm that I have completed the preparation and validation tasks above and I'm ready to enable Enhanced Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementEnableIntro
customLabels.label: This step replaces the current Recurring Donations processing logic with Enhanced Recurring Donations logic.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementEnableMessage
customLabels.label: Enable the Enhanced Recurring Donations functionality.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementEnableSimpleIntro
customLabels.label: This step changes the processing logic for Recurring Donations to use Enhanced Recurring Donations logic. Recurring Donations will not function the same way as before.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementEnableWarning
customLabels.label: WARNING: NPSP doesn't provide a way to revert back to legacy Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementIncomplete
customLabels.label: You cannot create or update Recurring Donations because you haven't finished enabling Enhanced Recurring Donations. Go to NPSP Settings | Recurring Donations | Upgrade to Enhanced Recurring Donations and complete all enablement steps.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementIntro
customLabels.label:
Greetings! Enhanced Recurring Donations is our redesigned and improved Recurring Donations feature for the Nonprofit Success Pack (NPSP). A big thanks to our community members who offered their feedback and helped make Enhanced Recurring Donations possible.

Since there's already a Recurring Donations feature in NPSP, you'll need to perform several upgrade tasks and move your existing data to the Enhanced Recurring Donations model. We've outlined the required tasks for you below.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMetaDeployConfirm
customLabels.label: Confirm that you have installed the Enhanced Recurring Donations metadata.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMetaDeployConfirmError
customLabels.label: You have not yet installed the Enhanced Recurring Donations metadata. Click Launch MetaDeploy and follow the instructions.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMetaDeployIntro
customLabels.label: Use MetaDeploy to install new metadata (picklist values, help text, etc.) for Enhanced Recurring Donations. MetaDeploy is a service that exists outside of your Salesforce org. Once you've installed the metadata, return to this page to continue the upgrade to Enhanced Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMetaDeployLaunch
customLabels.label: Install the Enhanced Recurring Donations metadata using the MetaDeploy service.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMetaDeploySimpleIntro
customLabels.label: Use our MetaDeploy service to install the Enhanced Recurring Donations metadata. The metadata includes: new picklist values, updated help text, and a new page layout. MetaDeploy is a service that exists outside of your Salesforce org.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMigrationCompleteMessage
customLabels.label:
Upgrade process complete!

Before your organisation starts using Enhanced Recurring Donations:
  • Turn on workflows, processes, validation rules and triggers that you disabled prior to upgrade.
  • Assign the Enhanced Recurring Donations page layout to all user profiles and remove the old Recurring Donations page layout.
  • Assign the NPSP Recurring Donation Lightning record page as the Org Default.
  • Assign the RD2_VisualiseScheduleController Apex class to your custom profiles.
  • Adjust field-level security for Recurring Donations fields as necessary for your profiles and permission sets.
  • Adjust Recurring Donations reports to work with Enhanced Recurring Donations.
  • Educate your staff about Enhanced Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMigrationErrorMessage
customLabels.label: Your migration run has errors, these will need to be fixed to complete a successful Migration. See the errors by going to NPSP Settings > System Tools > Error Logs.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMigrationIntro
customLabels.label: Migrate your existing Recurring Donations data to the Enhanced Recurring Donations data model. This process may take some time. You can leave this page and return later to check the progress.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementMigrationStepDryRun

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementPrepIntro

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementPrepTasks

• Disable workflows, processes, validation rules and triggers on the Recurring Donations, Opportunity, and Payment objects.
  • Backup your database, including all Recurring Donations and their related records.

customLabels.name: RD2_EnablementSimpleIntro
customLabels.label:
Enhanced Recurring Donations makes Recurring Donations more flexible and easier to manage than ever before. To enable Enhanced Recurring Donations, follow the steps below. You must complete ALL the steps to fully enable Enhanced Recurring Donations.

Because you have no Recurring Donation records, you don't need to validate or migrate any data.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationClosedDefinition
customLabels.label: After the specified number of days, NPSP updates the Recurring Donation Status to the Closed Status Value if donations aren't being received as expected. This value must be higher than the Number of Days for Lapsed. NPSP does not create instalment Opportunities for Closed Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationIntro
customLabels.label:
These settings automate changing the Recurring Donation Status when donors miss instalment payments.

For example, given a monthly Recurring Donation started on January 1st, and Number of Days for Lapsed is set to 10 days, the Recurring Donation becomes Lapsed on February 12th if no instalment payment is received. If Number of Days for Closed is set to 20 days, the Recurring Donation becomes Closed on February 22nd.

Salesforce begins counting Number of Days for Lapsed and Number of Days for Closed on the day after the expected instalment date (February 2nd in our example).

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationInvalidClosedStatus
customLabels.label: The Status Automation Closed Status should map to Closed State

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationInvalidLapsedStatus
customLabels.label: The Status Automation Lapsed Status should map to Lapsed State

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationInvalidNumberOfDays
customLabels.label: Number of Days for Closed must be higher than the Number of Days for Lapsed.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationInvalidNumberOfDaysForClosed
customLabels.label: Must be greater than Number of Days for Lapsed

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationInvalidNumberOfDaysForLapsed
customLabels.label: Must be less than Number of Days for Closed

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationNegativeNumberOfDays
customLabels.label: Number of Days for Lapsed and Number of Days for Closed cannot be negative.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusAutomationLapsedDefinition
customLabels.label: After the specified number of days, NPSP updates the Recurring Donation Status to the Lapsed Status Value if donations aren't being received as expected. NPSP continues to create instalment Opportunities for Lapsed Recurring Donations as defined by the schedule.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusMappingDefinitions
customLabels.label:
State Definitions
  • Active: The donor is actively donating. NPSP creates instalment Opportunities as defined by the Recurring Donation schedule.
  • Lapsed: Donations aren't being received as expected, but NPSP still creates instalment Opportunities as defined by the Recurring Donation schedule.
  • Closed: The donor has stopped making donations for this Recurring Donation. NPSP doesn't create any new instalment Opportunities.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusMappingDeploymentAlreadyInProgress
customLabels.label: You can't save a mapping while NPSP is processing another Status to State mapping.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusMappingIntro
customLabels.label:
When you create custom picklist values for Recurring Donation Status, you must map them to a State so that NPSP knows how to process records with those custom Status values.

If you haven't created any custom picklist values for Recurring Donation Status, there's nothing you need to map.

customLabels.name: RD2_StatusMustBeMappedSolution

customLabels.name: alloBatchDefaultInfo
customLabels.label:
This utility runs a batch process that creates default Allocations for all existing Opportunities, except Opportunities excluded in the GAU Allocations Rollup Settings.

To run this utility, default Allocations must be enabled and a default General Accounting Unit must be selected. You only need to run this tool once after enabling default Allocations, as all new Opportunities will receive a default Allocation once enabled.

To check your GAU Allocation settings, go to Donations | GAU Allocations.

customLabels.name: bdiDataImporterDescription
customLabels.label: The NPSP Data Importer helps you easily import your data into the Nonprofit Success Pack.

customLabels.name: bdiDataImporterInfoLine1
customLabels.label: If you're using Advanced Mapping you can map to any Salesforce object and field—standard or custom—that directly relates to Contacts, Accounts, and Opportunities. With Help Text mapping, each import record can contain up to 2 Contacts, up to 2 Organisations, an optional Home Address, and an optional Donation.

customLabels.name: bdiDataImporterInfoLine2
customLabels.label: Salesforce will try to match existing Contacts and Organisations, and update their information, rather than creating duplicate records.

customLabels.name: bdiDataImporterInfoLine2b
customLabels.label: In order to avoid reaching service limits, the NPSP Data Importer does not verify addresses through the verification service you may have specified in NPSP Settings.

customLabels.name: bdiDataImporterInfoLine3
customLabels.label: Salesforce will track any data import problems on individual import records. After resolving any issues, you can re-import those failed records without having to worry about creating duplicate records.

customLabels.name: bdiDataImporterInfoLine4
customLabels.label: The start of the data import may not begin immediately. Its processing depends on Salesforce's current activity.

customLabels.name: bdiOMUIPageDescriptionPt1
customLabels.label: Each row of this table shows your Object Groups. You'll set up individual field mappings when you click the dropdown icon for an Object Group, then click View Field Mappings.

customLabels.name: bdiOMUIPageDescriptionPt2
customLabels.label: Object Groups are collections of field mappings that tell the NPSP Data Import tool what types of records (e.g. Contacts, Opportunities, Payments, etc.) to create or update. NPSP is able to link related records within a single row of your import to one another because fields mappings are bundled in Object Groups in this way.

customLabels.name: bdiOMUIPageDescriptionPt3
customLabels.label: Let’s look at the two GAU Allocation 1 and GAU Allocation 2 Object Groups as an example. These object groups link directly to the Opportunity object. At times, you may want to assign two GAU Allocations to a single Opportunity. To achieve this, in your import file enter the Opportunity information in the Donations columns, then include the first GAU in the GAU Allocations 1 columns and the second GAU Allocation in the GAU Allocations 2 columns. Because of the GAU Allocation 1 and GAU Allocation 2 Object Mappings, when you import, the two GAU Allocations are both assigned to the Opportunity.

customLabels.name: bdiOMUIThroughFieldHelp
customLabels.label: The Lookup Relationship or Master-Detail field that connects your target object to the related Object Group. If the target object is a child of the related object, this field will be on the target object. Alternatively, if the target object is the parent of the related object, this field will be on the related object.

customLabels.name: batchNumberSettingsDescActivation
customLabels.label: Activate or deactivate batch number formats. One batch number format can be active at time.

customLabels.name: batchNumberSettingsDescDisplayFormat
customLabels.label:
Display Format allows you to control the appearance of your auto-numbered field. It must be unique and include the number of digits as well as a prefix, if desired. Your format can be up to 30 characters.

Examples
  • A sequence formatted as {0} with a starting number of 9 displays as 9, 10, 11, etc.
  • A sequence formatted as {00000} with a starting number of 9 displays as 00009, 00010, 00011, etc.
  • A sequence formatted as ABC-{0000} with a starting number of 9 displays as ABC-0009, ABC-0010, ABC-0011, etc.

customLabels.name: geBodyAdvancedFieldMapping
customLabels.label: For more advanced gift entry options, select fields from the following Object Groups.

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchTableColumnsPart1
customLabels.label: The batch table appears under your gift entry form and lists the gifts included in the batch.

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchTableColumnsPart2
customLabels.label:
We recommend including the following fields:
  • Donor Name—links to the Organisation Account or Contact giving the donation.
  • Donation Name—links to the Opportunity or Payment for the donation.
  • Status and Failure Information—information about batch processing.

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchFieldBundleInfo
customLabels.label: You can't set default values for fields included in this section.

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchHeaderLeftCol
customLabels.label: Choose fields to include in your Batch Header. Select the checkbox to add a field and deselect to remove the field from the form. If you'd like additional custom fields available for the Batch Header, add them in the NPSP Data Import Batch object.

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchHeaderRightCol
customLabels.label: For each field, you can edit the field label, mark it as required, or assign a default value. Default values can be overwritten by the person who creates the batch.

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchHeaderWarning
customLabels.label: These required fields were automatically added to the Batch Header:

customLabels.name: geBodyBatchDefaultValues
customLabels.label: Set default values for this batch. You can override default values when you enter gifts.

customLabels.name: geBodyEmptyFormSection
customLabels.label: Select fields to add to this section.

customLabels.name: geBodyFieldBundlesLeftCol
customLabels.label: Each field bundle is a managed set of fields that allow users to perform different gift entry actions.

customLabels.name: geBodyFormFieldsLeftCol
customLabels.label: Choose fields to include in your form. Before adding fields, click the section in the main Configure Form Fields screen where you want the fields to go. In this Form Fields & Field Bundles sidebar, select the checkbox to add a field, and deselect it to remove the field from the form. If the object or field you want to use isn't listed, make sure you've set up the field with Advanced Mapping.

customLabels.name: geBodyFormFieldsDescLeftCol
customLabels.label: These fields are commonly included in gift entry forms. Custom Object Groups are also found in this section.

customLabels.name: geBodyFormFieldsLeftColAdditional
customLabels.label:
Set up a field by completing the following steps:

  1. Create the field on the target object.
  2. Create the field on the NPSP Data Import object.
  3. If this is part of a new Object Group, create additional fields for a new Object group and create the new Object Group in NPSP Settings.
  4. Add Field Mapping in NPSP Settings to connect the NPSP Data Import field to the target field.
See NPSP documentation about Advanced Mapping for additional details.

customLabels.name: geBodyFormFieldsModalDeleteSection
customLabels.label: Deleting this section also removes any fields in it.

customLabels.name: geBodyFormFieldsRightCol
customLabels.label: Select a section, then select a field in the Form Fields & Field Bundles sidebar to add it to this section in the main Configure Form Fields screen. For each field, you can edit the field label, mark it as required, assign a default value or remove it from the section. Adjust the layout of the Gift Entry form by creating sections and reordering sections or fields.

customLabels.name: geBodyGiftEntryHelp
customLabels.label:
Before you enable Gift Entry, you must enable Advanced Mapping.

Use Gift Entry templates to enter single gifts or batches of gifts. All gifts entered through the older Batch Gift Entry tool are not displayed in Gift Entry and vice versa.

If preferred, you can disable Gift Entry and instead use older Batch Gift Entry (or Single Gift Entry, if using GEM).

customLabels.label: Learn more about NPSP Settings in the Planning Guide

customLabels.label: Take the time to customise your org's look and feel, so you can be sure your users can easily find the data they need.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemPageLayoutsLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Page Layouts in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemPrepareNPSPDesc
customLabels.label: Set specific goals and learn best practices for implementing Nonprofit Cloud.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemPrepareNPSPLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about NPSP Success in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemPrepareNPSPTitle
customLabels.label: Prepare for Success with Nonprofit Cloud

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemReviewCompanyDesc
customLabels.label: Within Salesforce, organisational information is referred to as "Company Information." Here you'll set up your org's default time zone, currency locale, and fiscal year start month. You can also find information about your licence usage.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemReviewCompanyLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Company Information settings in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemRunningReportsDesc
customLabels.label: Learn how to build reports and dashboards to bring your data to life and help tell the story of your organisation's impact.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemRunningReportsLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn how to customise NPSP Reports & Dashboards in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemSetupContactDesc
customLabels.label: Learn how to add relevant constituent data (for example a name, address, or employer) into your Salesforce instance.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemSetupContactLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Contacts and Accounts

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemSetupContactTitle
customLabels.label: Set Up a Contact and Household Account

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemStayTrackDesc
customLabels.label: Activities are tasks, events, or other interactions tracked in the Activity Timeline. Activities allow you to keep track of each time you have contact with a constituent. Learn how to leverage activities to log constituent interactions and assign tasks.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemStayTrackLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Activities in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemTrainUsersDesc
customLabels.label: When the day to launch your Salesforce org arrives, you want every user in your organisation to be ready. That's why it's important to make a plan for onboarding your users and helping them get the most out of Salesforce.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemTrainUsersLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about training your users in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistCreateConstituentRecordsDesc
customLabels.label: People are the heart of any nonprofit. Explore Nonprofit Success Pack features to learn how to manage your constituents and their household, personal, and professional connections.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemConnectContactOrganizationDesc
customLabels.label: Affiliations in NPSP let you capture important connections between your constituents and related organisations such as work, school, or business. Connect a Contact to an Organisation using Organisation Affiliations.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemConnectContactOrganizationLink
customLabels.label: Learn more about Affiliations in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemConnectContactOrganizationTitle
customLabels.label: Connect a Contact to an Organisation with Affiliations

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemConnectContactsRelationshipsDesc
customLabels.label: Relationships in NPSP let you capture important connections between your constituents. Connect Contacts using the Relationships related list on the Contact records.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemConnectContactsRelationshipsLink
customLabels.label: Learn more about Relationships in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCreateContactAndAccountDesc
customLabels.label: People are the most important resource for a nonprofit, so understanding how we use the Contact object to track them in NPSP is key. The Contact object stores constituent data such as name, address, and employer.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCreateContactAndAccountLink
customLabels.label: Learn more about Contacts and Accounts in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWhatIsNPCloudLink
customLabels.label: Learn more about the Nonprofit Cloud in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWhatIsNPCloudTitleDesc
customLabels.label: Nonprofit Cloud includes apps, tools, features, services, and technology designed to meet the unique needs of nonprofits.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWhatIsNPSPDesc
customLabels.label: The foundation of Nonprofit Cloud is the Nonprofit Success Pack (NPSP) app. NPSP helps you manage your constituents and fundraising efforts. If someone says they're using the "nonprofit version" of Salesforce, they're usually talking about NPSP.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWhatIsNPSPLink
customLabels.label: Learn more about Nonprofit Success Pack in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gsChecklistMakeItYourDesc
customLabels.label: Customise Salesforce with information that's unique to your organisation.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistOnboardUsersDesc
customLabels.label: Add your users to Salesforce and plan your rollout.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistWelcomeNPSPDesc
customLabels.label: Use these essential resources to help you get started with your NPSP journey.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistWelcomeNPSPTitle
customLabels.label: Welcome to Nonprofit Success Pack and Nonprofit Cloud

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemFundraisingProcessDesc
customLabels.label: Learn how to leverage built-in tools like list views and Path to effectively manage your fundraising and donation processes.

customLabels.name: gsChecklistItemFundraisingProcessLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about list views and Path in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistWorkRecordsDesc
customLabels.label: After you get your constituent and donation data into NPSP, you need to be able to easily find and interact with the records you're working on.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemGlobalSearchDesc
customLabels.label: When you're just getting started with NPSP, finding records can be tricky. Use global search to search across your entire Salesforce org and find what you need fast.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemGlobalSearchLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Search Results in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemStayTrackDesc
customLabels.label: The activities panel helps you and your colleagues capture all work related to a particular Contact, Organisation, or Opportunity. Log calls, assign tasks, send an email, and create calendar events right from the record you're working on.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemStayTrackLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Activities in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWorkMultipleRecordsDesc
customLabels.label: List views help you easily find what you need by providing filtered groups of Contacts, Accounts, Opportunities, and other objects.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWorkMultipleRecordsLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about List Views in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemWorkMultipleRecordsTitle
customLabels.label: Work with Multiple Records Using List Views

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemPrebuiltNPSPReportDesc
customLabels.label: NPSP includes 87 of the most commonly-used constituent and fundraising reports. Use these reports as is, or customise them.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemPrebuiltNPSPReportLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about NPSP Reports in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemStandardReportTypeDesc
customLabels.label: The Lightning Report Builder gives you the ability to create your own custom reports using standard report types. The report type you choose determines the objects and fields available in your report.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemStandardReportTypeLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Standard Report Types in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemStandardReportTypeTitle
customLabels.label: Create a Report from a Standard Report Type

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemViewDashboardDesc
customLabels.label: Dashboards pull data from one or more reports and display it side by side in the same window. NPSP includes three dashboards that you can use as is or customise.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemViewDashboardLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Dashboards in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistYourDataDesc
customLabels.label: Reports and Dashboards help organise your data so that you can tell the story of your organisation's impact. NPSP includes out-of-the-box reports, or you can create your own.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCaptureDonorIntentDesc
customLabels.label: When you raise funds for a specific purpose, you want to be sure you are honouring the donor intent. Ensure donations are allocated correctly with General Allocation Units.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCaptureDonorIntentLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Donation Allocations in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCaptureDonorIntentTitle
customLabels.label: Capture Donor Intent with Donation Allocations

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCollectGiftsDesc
customLabels.label: Monthly giving can provide a predictable source of nonprofit revenue, and sustaining donors are often a nonprofit's most loyal and committed supporters. Track monthly giving by creating a Recurring Donation.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCollectGiftsLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Recurring Donations in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemCollectGiftsTitle
customLabels.label: Collect Sustaining Gifts with Recurring Donations

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemDonationIndividualDesc
customLabels.label: For most nonprofits, donations come from individual contributions. Track individual donations by creating an Opportunity from a Contact record.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemDonationIndividualLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Individual Donations in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemDonationIndividualTitle
customLabels.label: Enter a Donation from an Individual

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemDonationOrganizationDesc
customLabels.label: Institutional and corporate giving are an important source of nonprofit support. Track organisational giving by creating an Opportunity from an Account record.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemDonationOrganizationLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Organisation Donations in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemDonationOrganizationTitle
customLabels.label: Enter a Donation from an Organisation

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemTrackDonationDesc
customLabels.label: Campaigns let you to track your constituent outreach in Salesforce. Use the Primary Campaign field on Opportunities to better evaluate your fundraising efforts.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistItemTrackDonationLinkLabel
customLabels.label: Learn more about Campaigns in Trailhead

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistTrackDonationDesc
customLabels.label: In NPSP, you track donations, grants, pledges, and other types of revenue using the Opportunity object. You can create donations from an individual or from an organisation such as a foundation, business, or government entity.

customLabels.name: gseuChecklistTrackDonationTitle
customLabels.label: Track Donations and Other Income Types with NPSP

customLabels.name: stgCRLPInfoOnUDRBody
customLabels.label:
Customisable Rollups offer all the functionality of User Defined Rollups and so much more:

● Roll up Payments in addition to Opportunities
● Use filters to easily exclude certain records or data
● Roll up data for more than 2 years back

Go to NPSP Settings | Donations | Customisable Rollups to enable Customisable Rollups and get started using them!

customLabels.name: stgCRLPInfoOnUDRHeading
customLabels.label: Why not try Customisable Rollups instead?

customLabels.name: stgCRLPNonAdminError
