customLabels.name: stgDeletePermissionError
customLabels.label: You don't have the required system permissions to delete this setting. Contact your system administrator for assistance.

customLabels.name: stgDIFMNonAdminError
customLabels.label: Only System Administrators can enable or disable Data Import Advanced Mapping.

customLabels.name: stgDeploymentHasInvalidHelpTextMappings
customLabels.label: Advanced Mapping is enabled, but we found some invalid Help Text mappings that couldn't be migrated. Take a screenshot of the table below; it will not be displayed again after you leave this page.

customLabels.name: stgDeploymentInProgress
customLabels.label: Deployment in progress. You can leave this page. The page will reload when deployment is finished.

customLabels.name: stgDontAutoScheduleHelpText
customLabels.label:
NPSP has a number of Scheduled Jobs that calculate rollups, update Recurring Donations and Seasonal Addresses, and perform error handling.

When Don't Auto Schedule Default NPSP Jobs is not selected, whenever you load the NPSP Settings page, NPSP checks that all the default NPSP Jobs are scheduled. If they're not scheduled, NPSP reschedules them. NPSP will reschedule only missing NPSP Jobs; it will not overwrite Jobs that have been updated.

To view these Jobs, search for Scheduled Jobs in Salesforce Setup.

Selecting Don't Auto Schedule Default NPSP Jobs tells NPSP not to check for or reschedule the default Jobs.

customLabels.name: stgEditPermissionError
customLabels.label: You don't have the required system permissions to edit this setting. Contact your system administrator for assistance.

customLabels.name: stgErrorINaming
customLabels.label: The Apex class you selected in the Implementing Class field does not implement the HH_INaming interface. Select a different Apex class, or use the default NPSP class HH_NameSpec.

customLabels.name: stgErrorMissingDefaultGauRecordWithPmtAllocEnabled
customLabels.label: The previously configured Default General Accounting Unit no longer exists and has been removed. You must re-enable Default Allocations and select a Default General Accounting Unit in order to use payment allocations. Open the GAU Allocations page in NPSP Settings to update the Default Allocation Settings.

customLabels.name: stgErrorMissingDefaultGauRecord
customLabels.label: The previously configured Default General Accounting Unit no longer exists and has been removed. To re-enable Default Allocations, open the GAU Allocations page in NPSP Settings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAccountModel
customLabels.label: The Account model used by the Nonprofit Success Pack. This option controls what happens when you create a Contact with a blank Account field value. WARNING: You should not use the Account Model record type you select as the default Account record type for any Profile. Doing so can cause various data issues.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAdvancedMapping1
customLabels.label: When you enable Advanced Mapping, we convert your existing Help Text field mappings to Advanced Mapping. Once enabled, you'll edit mappings and create new ones on this page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAdvancedMapping2
customLabels.label: You can disable Advanced Mapping and go back to Help Text mapping, but any changes you made with Advanced Mapping will be lost.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAdvancedMapping4
customLabels.label:
This message won't be displayed if you leave this page! Take a screenshot of this page or copy the information in the table below to track the Help Text mappings you need correct.

We couldn't convert some of your existing Help Text mappings because they're invalid. We recommend disabling Advanced Mapping, correcting the invalid Help Text mappings, then re-enabling Advanced Mapping. Alternatively, you could add these mappings when you configure Advanced Mapping on the next screen, but these additional mappings will revert to the original invalid Help Text if you disable Advanced Mapping.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAlloFiscalYearRollups
customLabels.label: When selected, this option enables fiscal year settings, rather than calendar year settings, for Allocation rollup totals. To set Fiscal Year information, go to Setup and search for Fiscal Year. NOTE: Nonprofit Success Pack does not support custom fiscal year settings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAlloNDayValue
customLabels.label: Sets the value for 'N day' rollups, where 'N' is the number of days from today into the past. This value defaults to roll up GAU Allocations over the past 365 days.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAllocationLevel
customLabels.label:
An allocation is the specific amount of a gift that goes to a designated General Accounting Unit (GAU). This setting determines whether funds are allocated based on the Amount on the Opportunity or the Amount on the Payment.

WARNING: Choosing to use Payment Allocations changes the way Opportunity Allocations work in your org. It's important that you understand these changes and the additional requirements that exist before enabling them.

If you enable and start using Payment Allocations and then disable them, you will need to manually reconcile your data and update Opportunity Allocation records to reflect the information previously assigned in Payment Allocations. Review the Payment Allocations documentation to better understand the potential impact.

When you enable Payment Allocations, existing rollups remain the same. We do not modify rollups or create new Custom Rollups. You can create new rollups based only on Payments, if you want to.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAutoAffil
customLabels.label: When selected, this option tells Salesforce to create or update Affiliations for Contacts connected to Organisation Accounts whenever the Contact's Account field or Primary Affiliation field changes. Organisations Accounts include all Record Types except those defined as Household or One-to-One Account Record Types.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAutoRelCampaignRT
customLabels.label: Select the Campaign Type(s) you'd like this Automatic Relationship to be created for.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAutoRelField
customLabels.label: The field that triggers the auto-creation of the Relationship.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAutoRelObject
customLabels.label: The Salesforce object associated with this auto-created Relationship..

customLabels.name: stgHelpAutoRelType
customLabels.label: The Relationship Type that you want to create between the base Contact or Campaign Member, and the corresponding Contact or Campaign Member. The corresponding Contact or Campaign Member will receive a Reciprocal Relationship value, if one is available.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBDEAllowBlankOppNames
customLabels.label: If selected, Batch Data Entry will not name Opportunities, even if you leave the Name field blank on the Batch Data Entry page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBDEOppNaming
customLabels.label: When selected, NPSP uses the default naming convention for batch-entered Opportunities, regardless of the value you enter in the Name field of the batch entry screen. NOTE: This setting has no effect if custom Opportunity Names are configured.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBatchAlloRollup
customLabels.label: This utility calculates rollup totals for all Closed Opportunities with Allocations and updates the relevant General Accounting Unit (GAU) records. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBatchCreateDefault
customLabels.label: Clicking this button starts a batch process that creates default allocations for all existing opportunities, except opportunities excluded in the Allocations Rollup Settings. Default allocations must be enabled and a default General Accounting Unit selected to run this tool.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBatchOppRollup
customLabels.label: This utility calculates rollup totals for all Closed Opportunities and updates the relevant Contacts, Households, and Accounts. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBtnHHNaming
customLabels.label:
WARNING: Clicking this button will activate Automatic Household Naming, and populate your existing Household Names, Formal Greetings, and Informal Greetings with new names, according to the formats you've chosen. Every single Household Account (or Household object) in your Salesforce organisation will be renamed (except those Households that do not have automatic naming enabled.)

This is an irreversible process. While you can deactivate Automatic Household Naming at any time, all newly populated names will remain.

Before starting this process, we recommend disabling the following when they affect Households:

● Custom Validation Rules
● Workflow Rules
● Process Builder
● Visual Workflows
● Custom Triggers

Once the process is 100% complete, you can safely leave or refresh this page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpBtnOppNaming
customLabels.label:
WARNING: Clicking this button will activate batch Opportunity renaming, and refresh all Opportunity Names according to the formats you've chosen. Salesforce will rename every Opportunity in your organisation except those Opportunities whose Opportunity Name Formats you've specified as "Do Not Rename."

This is an irreversible process. Before starting this process, we recommend that you back up your data. We also recommend disabling the following when they affect Opportunities:

● Custom Validation Rules
● Workflow Rules
● Process Builder
● Visual Workflows
● Custom Triggers

Once the process is 100% complete, you can safely leave or refresh this page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpChatterGroup
customLabels.label: Chatter group where error notifications will be posted.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCiceroAddrVerification
customLabels.label: Make sure you enter your Cicero API Key in the Auth Token settings field. You will find your API Key on your Cicero My Profile page at cicero.azavea.com

customLabels.name: stgHelpContactRTExcluded
customLabels.label: The Contact Record Types you want to exclude from automatic Household Member Contact Role creation. For example, you might want to create a "child" record type for children Contacts in the Household, and enter it here. Salesforce would then exclude those Contacts from receiving the Household Member Contact Role when the Opportunity is created.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCreateMissingPayments
customLabels.label:
WARNING: Clicking this button will activate batch Payment creation. NPSP will create a Payment for each Opportunity without Payments that:

● has an amount greater than zero
● is not marked Do Not Automatically Create Payment
● is not excluded in the Donations | Payments settings

This is an irreversible process. Before starting this process, we recommend disabling the following when they affect Payments:

● Custom Validation Rules
● Workflow Rules
● Process Builder
● Visual Workflows
● Custom Triggers

Once the process is 100% complete, you can safely leave or refresh this page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCustomizableRollupsEnable2
customLabels.label:
When you enable Customizable Rollups for the first time, we will automatically convert your existing rollups and the 87 out-of-box NPSP rollups into Customizable Rollups.

You can disable and go back to legacy rollups, but any new rollups or rollup/filter changes made in Customizable Rollups won't be applied to your legacy rollup settings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCustomizableRollupsEnable3
customLabels.label: Removes any new rollups, filter groups, and filter rules you created while using Customisable Rollups AND resets all NPSP legacy rollups back to their default behaviour.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultAllocationsEnabled
customLabels.label: When selected, NPSP automatically creates GAU Allocation records allocated to the General Accounting Unit specified in the Default General Accounting Unit field below. This feature enables better reporting on the Default General Accounting Unit, but uses more data storage.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultGAU
customLabels.label: When Default Allocations Enabled is selected, NPSP creates a GAU Allocation for all new Opportunities not excluded in GAU Allocations Rollup Settings, and assigns them to this General Accounting Unit. NOTE: This doesn't include existing unallocated Opportunities. You can allocate them to the default General Accounting Unit in NPSP Settings under Bulk Data Processes | Batch Create Default Allocations.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDisableHHAccountAddr
customLabels.label: Disables Address management for Household Accounts when selected.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableSoftCreditRollups
customLabels.label: When selected, rolls up Closed/Won Opportunity totals to Contact records based on assigned Opportunity Contact Roles. Soft credit rollups only happen in nightly batches, but you can run them manually from the Rollup Donations Batch settings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEnhancedRDBatch
customLabels.label:
This utility runs a batch process that creates the next scheduled instalment Opportunities for Recurring Donations and updates the Recurring Donation Statistics fields.

This process may take some time, but you can close this page and the process will continue in the background.

customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorLog
customLabels.label: The Error Log shows a detailed list of errors for debugging purposes. Errors are logged only if Error Handling and the Store Errors options are enabled in System Tools | Error Notifications.

customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorNotifyOn
customLabels.label: When selected, NPSP will display notifications for certain types of errors.

customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorNotifyTo
customLabels.label: Select the type of user to send notifications to.

customLabels.name: stgHelpExampleHHNames
customLabels.label: NOTE: The above preview examples cannot preview information for fields other than First Name, Last Name, or Salutation. (For example, if you've created a custom field for nickname that you want to use in the Informal Greeting, that custom field would not show up here.) Fields other than First Name, Last Name, and Salutation don't show up in the greetings fields of the Manage Household page either, but when you save Contact information from the Manage Household page, your Household naming conventions will appear correctly.

customLabels.name: stgHelpFGFormat
customLabels.label: The format Salesforce uses for the Formal Greeting.

customLabels.name: stgHelpFiscalYearRollups
customLabels.label: When checked, this option enables fiscal year settings, rather than calendar year settings, for Opportunity rollup totals. To set fiscal year information, go to Setup | Company Profile | Fiscal Year. NOTE: The Nonprofit Success Pack does not support custom fiscal year settings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHAccountRTID
customLabels.label: The Account record type you want to use for new Accounts if you've selected the Household Account model above. You can select the default Household Account record type, or your own record type. If you select --None--, then Salesforce will use the default Account record type for the user who's creating the new Contact (and associated Account).

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHData
customLabels.label: Use these bulk data processes to refresh Household names and recalculate data for the All Household Members Deceased field. After running one of these processes, refresh your browser to run the other one.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHExcludedRT
customLabels.label: Specifies which Contact record types Salesforce will exclude from Household object creation. (Applies to One-to-One or Individual Account Models only.)

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHMailingListReport
customLabels.label: The Household Mailing List Report deduplicates a Campaign that contains multiple Contacts from the same household in order to help prevent sending multiples of the same mailing to the same address. NPSP includes a report you can select called "NPSP Campaign Household Mailing List V2". If that report has been renamed or deleted, select a report that uses the Campaigns with Contacts report type, with filters for Member Status does not contain "Duplicate", and Campaign Id = blank.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHNameFormat
customLabels.label: The format Salesforce uses for the Household Name.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHNaming
customLabels.label: If selected, Salesforce automatically creates a name for the Household Account (or Household object), based on the name of the Contacts in the Household. Salesforce also automatically generates formal and informal greetings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHOCROn
customLabels.label: When selected, NPSP automatically creates Contact Roles on Individual gifts for Household members of the Opportunity's Primary Contact.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHHRules
customLabels.label: Specifies for which Contacts Salesforce will automatically create separate Household objects. (Applies to One-to-One or Individual Account Models only.)

customLabels.name: stgHelpHealthCheck
customLabels.label: Use Health Check to verify your NPSP configuration!

customLabels.name: stgHelpIGFormat
customLabels.label: The format Salesforce uses for the Informal Greeting.

customLabels.name: stgHelpINamingClass
customLabels.label: The Apex Class that implements the HH_INaming interface for Household naming.

customLabels.name: stgHelpLeadConvert
customLabels.label: Specifies the default behaviour for Opportunity creation when you convert a Lead to a Contact. If left unselected, Salesforce will NOT automatically create an Opportunity when you convert Leads to Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpLvlAssignBatch
customLabels.label:
This utility calculates Level Assignments for all Salesforce objects (typically Accounts and Contacts, but also any custom objects) that have Levels assigned to them. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.

IMPORTANT: Since Salesforce is often evaluating Levels against updated fields from other bulk data processes, you may want to run those processes first.

customLabels.name: stgHelpMatchedDonorRole
customLabels.label: The Contact Role you want to use for matched donors. We recommend using "Matched Donor."

customLabels.name: stgHelpMaxPayments
customLabels.label: Sets the maximum number of Payments allowed when scheduling Payments for an Opportunity. If no value is entered, the default is 12.

customLabels.name: stgHelpMembershipGracePeriod
customLabels.label: After a Membership ends, the length of the grace period (in days) before the Membership Status on the Account moves from Grace Period to Expired. Defaults to 30 days.

customLabels.name: stgHelpMembershipRT
customLabels.label: The Record Type used when creating Opportunities that track Membership Donations. We recommend using Membership. Opportunities with this record type roll up separately from other Opportunity Record Types.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNPSPSettings
customLabels.label: Configure the Nonprofit Success Pack to meet your organisation's needs. You can also monitor the health of your Salesforce organisation, or run batch processes to update data.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNameConnector
customLabels.label: Specifies the name or character (such as &) that Salesforce uses to connect pairs in a name.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNameOverrun
customLabels.label: Specifies the text Salesforce uses to replace longer lists of names.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNewRDFieldMap
customLabels.label: Select the Recurring Donation field you want to map, and the Opportunity field you want to map it to. NPSP will copy the value of the Recurring Donation field you select to your selected Opportunity field on all child Opportunities for the Recurring Donation. IMPORTANT: Both of these fields must have the same data type.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNewUDR
customLabels.label: Select the Opportunity field and corresponding rollup operation, then select the object and field to roll up to.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNoUDR
customLabels.label: No User Defined Rollups Have Been Defined

customLabels.name: stgHelpOCR
customLabels.label: Soft Credits, Contact Roles, and Matching Gifts relate to each other in important ways. If you're not familiar with these concepts and how they interact, you should read through the NPSP Documentation before making any adjustments to these settings.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOCRDefaultRole
customLabels.label: The default Contact Role automatically assigned to the Primary Contact when the Opportunity Account is a Household, One-to-One, or Individual Account.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOrgOCRDefaultRole
customLabels.label: The default Contact Role automatically assigned to the Opportunity's Primary Contact when the Opportunity's Account is NOT a Household, One-to-One, or Individual Account.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOCRRoleForHH
customLabels.label: The Contact Role you want to use for Household Members.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOneToOneRTID
customLabels.label: The Account record type you want to use for new Accounts if you've selected the One-to-One Account model above. NPSP does not come with a default record type for One-to-One Accounts, so you should create one (such as "Individual") before selecting this model. If you select --None--, then Salesforce will use the default Account record type for the user who's creating the new Contact (and associated One-to-One Account).

customLabels.name: stgHelpOppNamingAttribution
customLabels.label: Specifies whether you want to apply these settings to Contact Donations (i.e. Opportunities associated with Household, 1-to-1, or Individual "Bucket" Accounts), Organisation Donations, or both Contact and Organisation Donations.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOppNamingDateFormat
customLabels.label: The date format used for any Date or DateTime fields referenced in the Opportunity Name Format. Choose a format, or choose "other" to create your own custom format following the Java SimpleDateFormat specification.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOppNamingFormat
customLabels.label: The Opportunity Name format. Choose "other" to create your own.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOppNamingRecTypes
customLabels.label: The Opportunity record type(s) to which you want to apply this Opportunity Name. Control or Command click to select more than one record type. "--None--" applies the new naming to ALL record types.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOppRecTypesNoPayments
customLabels.label: Salesforce won't automatically create Payments for the selected Opportunity record types. Control or Command click to select more than one record type.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOppTypesNoPayments
customLabels.label: Salesforce won't automatically create Payments for Opportunities that have this value in the Type picklist.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOrgAccountAddressMgmt
customLabels.label: When selected, enables Address Management for non-Household Accounts such as Organisational Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOverrunCount
customLabels.label: The number of Contacts Salesforce will explicitly name in Household names and greetings. After this number, Salesforce substitutes the Name Overrun value for names.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPaymentMapOppField
customLabels.label: The Opportunity field to copy from.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPaymentMapPaymentField
customLabels.label: The Payment field to copy to.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPaymentMapping
customLabels.label: Set up a mapping by selecting an Opportunity field, and then selecting the Payment field it maps to. NOTE: Payment mapping requires that you have two fields (one on Opportunity, one on Payment) of a matching data type.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPaymentMappings
customLabels.label: Map fields so that values from the Opportunity are automatically copied to the Payment. Mapping applies for auto-created Payments or Payments created through the Payment scheduler.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPaymentsEnabled
customLabels.label: If enabled, Salesforce automatically creates Payments for new Opportunities (Donations).

customLabels.name: stgHelpPowerOfUsHub
customLabels.label:
Got questions? Try the Nonprofit Success Pack group for questions about NPSP and the System Administrators group for questions about Salesforce administration and configuration.

Keep up with the latest NPSP release notes in the NPSP Release Announcements group.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPrimaryContactBatch
customLabels.label:
WARNING: Clicking this button will activate a batch Opportunity update to refresh the Primary Contact field. Salesforce will update Opportunity records where the Primary Contact field isn't the same value as the Opportunity Contact Role record marked Primary.

This is an irreversible process. This change updates Opportunity records. Before starting this process, we recommend that you back up your data. We also recommend disabling the following when they affect Opportunities:

● Custom Validation Rules
● Workflow Rules
● Process Builder
● Visual Workflows
● Custom Triggers

Once the process is 100% complete, you can safely leave or refresh this page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpPrimaryContactRoleMergeBatch
customLabels.label:
WARNING: Clicking this button will activate a batch that permanently removes any duplicate Primary Opportunity Contact Roles that exist in your org. These records won't be recoverable in the recycle bin, so be careful to review expected changes in advance.

This is an irreversible process. This change updates Opportunity Contact Role records. Before starting this process, we recommend that you back up your data. We also recommend disabling the following when they affect Opportunities:

● Custom Validation Rules
● Workflow Rules
● Process Builder
● Visual Workflows
● Custom Triggers

Once the process is 100% complete, you can safely leave or refresh this page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDeceasedBatch
customLabels.label: This utility recalculates the value in the All Household Members Deceased field on Household Accounts. Run this utility to ensure that the value correctly reflects the status of the Deceased field on related Contacts. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDAddCampaign
customLabels.label: When selected, NPSP copies the Campaign you specified on the Recurring Donation to its instalment Opportunities.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDBatch
customLabels.label:
This utility runs a batch process for all open-ended Recurring Donations, and based on the number of Opportunity Forecast Months:

● creates new opportunities
● updates the number of Instalments and Paid Amount

This process may take some time, but you can close this page and the process will continue in the background.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDBatchSize
customLabels.label: The number of records to process at a time when running the Recurring Donations batch job. The default size is 50. Reduce to a smaller number if the batch job is failing due to system limits.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDDisableScheduling
customLabels.label: Prevents the scheduling of the nightly update to Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDFailures
customLabels.label: The number of Recurring Donations that failed to update in the last batch operation.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDFieldMap
customLabels.label: This setting lets you map fields from the Recurring Donation record to the Recurring Donation's child Opportunities.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDLastRun
customLabels.label: The date and time of the last batch update of Recurring Donations.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDMaxDonations
customLabels.label: Restricts the total number of Donations (instalments) for Fixed-Length Recurring Donations. The default is 50.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDOpenOppBehavior
customLabels.label: Tells NPSP what to do with any remaining open Opportunities when you mark the status of an Open-Ended Recurring Donation as Closed.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDOppForecastMonths
customLabels.label: Number of months' worth of open Opportunities that NPSP maintains on Open-Ended Recurring Donations. NPSP makes sure there are always this many months' worth of Opportunities by creating the appropriate number of new Opportunities every month.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDOppRT
customLabels.label: The Opportunity record type assigned to the Recurring Donation's instalment Opportunities.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDInstallmentCreateOptionMessage
customLabels.label: Specifies when NPSP will create instalment Opportunities for Recurring Donations. The default is Always Create Next Instalment.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDPeriodFrequency
customLabels.label: The amount of time the Custom Instalment Period covers.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDPeriodName
customLabels.label: The name of the new Custom Instalment Period.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDPeriodType
customLabels.label: The unit of time (days, weeks, months, years) for the Custom Instalment Period.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRDSuccesses
customLabels.label: Number of Recurring Donations successfully updated in the last batch run.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRecDon
customLabels.label: This setting lets you create Custom Instalment Periods for Recurring Donations, different from the default Instalment Periods (monthly, quarterly, yearly, and so on) that come with NPSP.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelAutoCreatedDup
customLabels.label: NPSP deduplicates auto-created Relationships. Select this option if you want to disable automatic deduplication, and allow multiple Relationships of the same Type to exist between two Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelFieldSyncToggle
customLabels.label: Select this option to sync custom Relationships fields between the two Contacts in a relationship pair.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelGenderField
customLabels.label: Custom field that specifies the gender of a Contact. Salesforce uses the value in this field to determine reciprocal relationships.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalFemale
customLabels.label: The value Salesforce uses if the Contact's Gender field value is Female, or if the Contact's Salutation indicates gender.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalMale
customLabels.label: The value Salesforce uses if the Contact's Gender field value is Male, or if the Contact's Salutation indicates gender.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalMethod
customLabels.label: Specifies the method used for generating reciprocal relationships.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalName
customLabels.label: The name of the Relationship. The name will be an option Users can select in the Type picklist when creating a Relationship between Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalNeutral
customLabels.label: The value Salesforce uses if it cannot determine the Contact's gender based on Gender field value or Salutation.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelSyncFields
customLabels.label: Select the custom Relationship fields you do not want synchronised between the two Contacts in a Relationship pair. Control or command click to select more than one field.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRespectDuplicateRuleSettings
customLabels.label: Respect the settings on a Duplicate Rule that control whether duplicate records are allowed. To check your existing settings, go to Duplicate Rules under Setup. For any rule, when the Action On Create or Action On Edit fields are set to "Allow," duplicates will be saved.

customLabels.name: stgHelpReviewErrorLog
customLabels.label: Review Error Logs to see if there are issues.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupBatchSize
customLabels.label: The number of records processed at a time when calculating donor statistics. The default size is 200. Reduce to a smaller number if the Opportunity Rollups are failing due to system limits.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupExcludeAccountOppRT
customLabels.label: Opportunities with the selected record types won't be included in rollups to the Account. Control or Command click to select more than one record type.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupExcludeAccountOppType
customLabels.label: Opportunities that have this value in the Type picklist won't be included in rollups to the Account.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupExcludeAlloOppRecType
customLabels.label: GAU Allocations from Opportunities with the selected record types won't be included when rolling up to the General Accounting Unit record.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupExcludeAlloOppType
customLabels.label: GAU Allocations from Opportunities that have this value in the Type picklist won't be included when rolling up to the General Accounting Unit record.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupExcludeContactOppRT
customLabels.label: Opportunities with the selected record types won't be included in rollups to the Contact. Control or Command click to select more than one record type.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupExcludeContactOppType
customLabels.label: Opportunities that have this value in the Type picklist won't be included in rollups to the Contact.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupNDayValue
customLabels.label: Sets the value for 'N day' rollups, where 'N' is the number of days from today into the past. This value defaults to rollup over the past 365 days.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupPrimaryContact
customLabels.label: When this option is selected, Salesforce will ALWAYS roll up donor data to the Opportunity's Primary Contact. Note that only the Account on the Opportunity will receive hard credit. So, if the Account Name on the Opportunity is an Organisation, that Organisation and the Primary Contact will receive hard credit; the Contact's Household or 1:1 Account will NOT receive hard credit. If left unselected, and the Opportunity's Account is an Organisation, only the Organisation will receive credit for the Opportunity.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRollupSkewLimit
customLabels.label: The maximum number of related Opportunities on an Account or Contact allowed in the non-Skew Mode Rollup Batch Jobs. An Account or Contact with more than this number of related Opportunities will always be rolled up using Skew Mode.

customLabels.name: stgHelpSalesforceSetup
customLabels.label: Looking to customise page layouts, add fields, or add users? Try the Salesforce Setup pages.

customLabels.name: stgHelpSimpleAddrChangeIsUpdate
customLabels.label: A simple address change is a change (such as correcting a typo, or deleting white space) to a single Contact or Account address field. When this option is selected, Salesforce treats these changes as updates to the existing address (i.e., no new Address object is created).

customLabels.name: stgHelpSoftCreditRoles
customLabels.label: Opportunity Contact Roles you want to include in Soft Credit rollups. Control or Command click to select multiple roles.

customLabels.name: stgHelpStoreErrorsOn
customLabels.label: When selected, NPSP will store errors. You can view stored errors in System Tools | Error Log on the NPSP Settings page.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTDTM
customLabels.label: Trigger Handlers contain the actual business logic that needs to be executed for a particular trigger event.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTHActive
customLabels.label: Indicates that this Trigger Handler is active and will run when Trigger Action criteria is met.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTHAsync
customLabels.label: Indicates that this trigger handler's After Events should run asynchronously. WARNING: If the specified Apex Class doesn't support asynchronous processing and you select this checkbox, the class may not work properly.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTHLoadOrder
customLabels.label: Order in which this trigger should be run. If the records that this trigger handler processes have related records, the load order ensures that they're created or updated in the correct order.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTHObject
customLabels.label: The object related to this trigger handler.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTHTriggerAction
customLabels.label: Actions that fire this trigger. Ctrl and Command click to select more than one action.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTriggerHandlers
customLabels.label: These triggers control core functionality in the Nonprofit Success Pack, so please exercise extreme caution when creating or modifying them.

customLabels.name: stgHelpTriggerHandlersAsync
customLabels.label: If you select the Asynchronous After Events option for a Trigger Handler, it can have unintended consequences. You should test the Trigger Handler thoroughly in a sandbox environment before deploying it to production.

customLabels.name: stgHelpUDROperation
customLabels.label: Determines how the field should roll up. Only operations that are valid for the selected Opportunity field are listed.

customLabels.name: stgHelpUDROppField
customLabels.label: The Opportunity field to roll up.

customLabels.name: stgHelpUDRTargetObject
customLabels.label: The object on which the rollup information will appear.

customLabels.name: stgHelpUseDatedConvRates
customLabels.label: When checked, Dated Exchange Rates are used for currency conversion. If unchecked, the standard exchange rate is used even if Advanced Currency Management is enabled.

customLabels.name: stgInstallScriptError
customLabels.label:
Your installation was successful, but we detected a slight problem. To fix the problem, simply load the NPSP Settings page in Salesforce.
Note: The NPSP Settings tab is visible in the Nonprofit Success Pack application. If you don't see the tab, select Nonprofit Success Pack from the app menu in the upper-right corner.

customLabels.name: stgLabelBatchJobRollupSkewSizes
customLabels.label: Rollup Batch Job Skew Mode Sizes

customLabels.name: stgLabelHonoreeNotificationHelpText
customLabels.label: Auto-create Opportunity Contact Roles for Honouree and Notification Recipient Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgLabelHonoreeNotificationOCR
customLabels.label: Honouree and Notification Recipient Opportunity Contact Roles

customLabels.name: stgLabelUDRTargetFieldHelp
customLabels.label: The custom field on the target object that will display your custom rollup summary. This field must be of the same type as the Opportunity field you're rolling up.

customLabels.name: stgOppNamingDescription
customLabels.label: When you create an Opportunity, the Name is automatically populated using a default naming convention. You can customise the naming convention by creating custom Opportunity Names.

customLabels.name: stgRDNamingDescription
customLabels.label: When you create a Recurring Donation, NPSP automatically populates the Name using the specified name format. Choose Disable Automatic Naming to turn this feature off.

customLabels.name: stgValidationHHAccountHHRules
customLabels.label: The Account Model is set to 'Household Account', which requires Household Rules to be set to 'No Contacts'. When using Household Accounts, there is no need to have an additional Household Object.
